definition: to hang or suspend/to worry/public announcement/unresolved/baseless/without foundation

to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)

pinyin: xuan2 gua4 shi4 hua2 xiang2 ji1

sentences.english: According to the story, the practice of hanging up stockings is connected with St. Nicholas.
sentences.chinese: 据传，悬挂袜子的习俗与圣尼古拉有关。

sentences.english: Short dangling chains shine with multi-coloured bezel-set crystals.
sentences.chinese: 悬挂着的短饰链配上富多种颜色的包边镶嵌水晶。

sentences.english: I suspended a rope-ladder from the rail of the ship.
sentences.chinese: 我将一个软梯悬挂在船栏杆上。

sentences.english: Currents of warm air keep the hang-gliders aloft.
sentences.chinese: 悬挂式滑翔机借着暖气流在高空飞行。

sentences.english: Books hang on metal strips, creating the levitation effect. [link]
sentences.chinese: 书本都悬挂在金属架子上，创造出一种悬浮的效果。

sentences.english: In the former design, the leaf springs clamp directly to the drive axle.
sentences.chinese: 在早期的后悬挂的设计中，片簧直接钳在驱动轴上。

sentences.english: A sword is hung above his head.
sentences.chinese: 一枝剑悬挂在他头的上方。

sentences.english: The upper staircase is suspended from the ceiling by white rods that create a minimal balustrade.
sentences.chinese: 上层楼梯利用从天花板悬挂下的白棒作为扶手栏杆。

sentences.english: Our granddaddies swung on them nooses . Our grandmamas swung on them nooses .
sentences.chinese: 我们的爷爷奶奶们悬挂在绳套上。

sentences.english: They swung huge car advertisements from the top of the tall buildings.
sentences.chinese: 他们从高楼顶上向下悬挂了巨大的汽车广告。

sentences.english: Front suspension is by MacPherson struts, with coil springs and an anti-roll bar.
sentences.chinese: 前悬挂是麦花臣支柱与线圈，弹簧和防滚杆。

sentences.english: An application is unresponsive or hangs indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 应用程序无响应或无限期悬挂。

sentences.english: Once there were blue skies, with white clouds high above.
sentences.chinese: 曾经，这儿有蓝天，白云高高悬挂。

sentences.english: Mr Bouazizi's picture hangs in the main street, now named after him.
sentences.chinese: 布亚齐兹的照片悬挂在以他的名字命名的大街上。

sentences.english: Hang a couple of bird feeders in a tree and set up a bird bath.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在树上悬挂几个喂食器或放置一个小鸟浴盆。

sentences.english: Chinese lanterns hang from the ceilings of the main entrance hall.
sentences.chinese: 在正门入口处，大红的中国灯笼高高悬挂着。

definition: to hang up (a picture, banner, mosquito net etc)
to set up/to arrange/to lay out
to hang in the air/suspended in midair/(fig.) uncertain
to inlay/to embed/to set (e.g. a jewel in a ring)/tiling/tesselation
to tower/standing tall and upright (of large building)
